alert.note: Alert for Martin; Okeechobee; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 6:41PM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Martin, Okeechobee and St. Lucie. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 640 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Port Saint Lucie, Walton, Fort Pierce, Stuart, Indiantown, White City, Palm City, Jensen Beach, Saint Lucie Nuclear Power Plant, J And S Fish Camp, Fort Pierce Inlet, Port Salerno, Sewall`s Point, Tradition, Saint Lucie West, Port Saint Lucie River Park, North River Shores, Fort Pierce South, Indian River Estates and Nettles Island. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
